W
Wildlife Centre

Conservation Tips

Simple ways you can help British wildlife at home.

Create a Hedgehog Highway

Hedgehog

Cut a small CD-sized hole in your garden fence to allow hedgehogs to roam freely between gardens in search of food and mates.

Leave a Wild Corner

General

Let a patch of grass grow long to provide shelter for insects, amphibians, and small mammals.

Keep it Wild

Red Fox

Never approach or feed wild foxes. They need to stay wild to survive and avoid conflict with humans.

Check Before Mowing

Hedgehog

Always check long grass carefully for hedgehogs and other wildlife before mowing or lighting bonfires.

Watch the Road

Badger

Drive carefully in rural areas, especially at night. Badgers and other nocturnal animals are vulnerable to road traffic.

Rat Poison Danger

Barn Owl

Avoid using rodenticides. Barn owls and other predators can be fatally poisoned by eating affected rodents.

Plant Native

Red Squirrel

Plant native trees and hazel that provide natural food sources for Red Squirrels.

Migration Help

Common Toad

During spring evenings, help toads cross roads safely to reach their breeding ponds (with adult supervision!).
